cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north then north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, expected to strike Florida’s Big Bend and then sweep across GA/SC into the Atlantic off the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key–Aucilla River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch south of Englewood to Chokoloskee FL and Lower Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Pinar del Rio Cuba; Tropical Storm Warning for portions of Yucatan Peninsula, Isle of Youth, Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeastern Georgia, the Carolinas, and portions of the Mid-Atlantic including coastal Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thu night–Fri; gusty NE/N winds 20–30 kt possible in rain bands
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent rivers during onshore flow Friday
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Thu night–Fri could total 2–4 in, isolated 4+ in especially with any outer rain band training
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, elevated seas, minor coastal flooding and restricted vessel movements possible in the Hampton Roads approaches
